goals.question: What is the trend of the number of incidents reported during the LA riots?
goals.visualization: Line chart of the number of incidents reported over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the overall pattern of the incidents reported during the LA riots and identify any spikes or dips in the number of incidents.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the type of incidents reported during the LA riots?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the count of each type of incident
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the most common types of incidents reported during the LA riots and identify any outliers or unusual patterns.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the number of incidents reported and the location of the incident?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of the number of incidents reported by location
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there are any areas that were particularly affected by the LA riots and if there is any correlation between the location of the incident and the number of incidents reported.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the severity of the incidents reported during the LA riots?
goals.visualization: Histogram of the severity of the incidents reported
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the severity of the incidents reported during the LA riots and identify any outliers or unusual patterns.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the number of incidents reported and the time of day?
goals.visualization: Line chart of the number of incidents reported by time of day
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there are any particular times of day when incidents were more likely to occur during the LA riots and if there is any correlation between the time of day and the number of incidents reported.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]
    
    data['count'] = 1
    data_grouped = data.groupby(data['date'].dt.date).sum().reset_index()
    
    plt.plot(data_grouped['date'], data_grouped['count'], label='Incidents')
    plt.xlabel('Date')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Incidents')
    plt.title('What is the trend of the number of incidents reported during the LA riots?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend()
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    incident_counts = data['incident_type'].value_counts()
    incident_counts.plot(kind='bar', color='blue', legend=True)
    plt.title("What is the distribution of the type of incidents reported during the LA riots?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Incident Type")
    plt.ylabel("Count")
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['location'], data['number_of_incidents'])
    plt.xlabel('Location')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Incidents')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the number of incidents reported and the location of the incident?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(['Incidents'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['severity'].plot.hist(bins=10, alpha=0.5, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    plt.title("What is the distribution of the severity of the incidents reported during the LA riots?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Severity")
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.axvline(data['severity'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['severity'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['time_of_day'] = pd.to_datetime(data['time_of_day'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['time_of_day'])]
    data['hour'] = data['time_of_day'].dt.hour

    incidents_by_hour = data.groupby('hour')['incident_id'].count()

    plt.plot(incidents_by_hour.index, incidents_by_hour.values)
    plt.xlabel('Time of Day (Hour)')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Incidents Reported')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the number of incidents reported and the time of day?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(range(0, 24))
    plt.legend(['Incidents Reported'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
